alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Dubois; Orange (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Dubois, northwestern Crawford and southwestern Orange Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 459 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Jasper, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Crawford, southwestern Orange and eastern Dubois Counties, including the following locations... Dubois, Hillham, Celestine, Saint Marks, Dubois Crossroads, Norton, Mentor, Birdseye, French Lick and Ellsworth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
